meanings.definition: Serving as an introduction or preface.
meanings.sent1: The prolegomenous chapter of the book provided background information.
meanings.sent2: The prolegomenous remarks set the stage for the main presentation.
meanings.sent3: The prolegomenous jokes at the beginning of the comedy show warmed up the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her prolegomenous smile before the speech hinted at what was to come.
meanings.sent5: The prolegomenous music played softly in the background, creating a soothing atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The prolegomenous steps were essential before starting the experiment.
meanings.sent2: She completed the prolegomenous tasks before diving into the main project.
meanings.sent3: His prolegomenous stretching routine helped him avoid injuries during the game.
meanings.sent4: The prolegomenous meeting laid the groundwork for future collaborations.
meanings.sent5: The prolegomenous checklist ensured that everything was in order before the event.
